    • Method Detail

      • open

        void open()
        Open and be ready to read / write.

      • getMemberCount

        int getMemberCount(String collectionId)
        Get a count of all members of a collection, where 'member' means the collection is the immediate parent of the item. The count is not recursive and it will include all resources and collections whose immediate parent is the collection identified by the parameter.

      • getResourcesOfType

        Collection<org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource> getResourcesOfType(String resourceType,
                                                                          int pageSize,
                                                                          int page)
        Retrieve a collection of ContentResource objects pf a particular resource-type. The collection will contain no more than the number of items specified as the pageSize, where pageSize is a non-negative number less than or equal to 1028. The resources will be selected in ascending order by resource-id. If the resources of the specified resource-type in the ContentHostingService in ascending order by resource-id are indexed from 0 to M and this method is called with parameters of N for pageSize and I for page, the resources returned will be those with indexes (I*N) through ((I+1)*N - 1). For example, if pageSize is 1028 and page is 0, the resources would be those with indexes of 0 to 1027.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.RESOURCE_TYPE_ID equals resourceType
        pageSize - (page) size of results
        page - (page) increment of results
        Returns:
        collection of ContentResource

      • getContextResourcesOfType

        Collection<org.sakaiproject.content.api.ContentResource> getContextResourcesOfType(String resourceType,
                                                                                 Set<String> contextIds)
        Retrieve a collection of ContentResource objects of a particular resource-type in a set of contexts.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.RESOURCE_TYPE_ID equals resourceType
        contextIds - select resources where CONTENT_RESOURCE.CONTEXT in [context,...]
        Returns:
        collection of ContentResource
